definitions.definition: To kill someone by squeezing the throat so as to cut off the oxygen supply ; to choke , suffocate or throttle .
examples: She strangled her husband and dissolved the body in acid.

definitions.definition: To be killed by strangulation, or become strangled.
examples: The cat slipped from the branch and strangled on its bell-collar.

definitions.definition: To be stifled, choked, or suffocated in any manner.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To kill someone by squeezing the throat so as to cut off the oxygen supply ; to choke , suffocate or throttle .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To be killed by strangulation, or become strangled.
( intransitive ) To be stifled, choked, or suffocated in any manner.
